X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=KoOpoghr6s_GJPoUzk6bSSVvV5cdGv7JdodByMGlWxik

What Java VM?

The initial error you reported is suggestive that there was some 
corruption in the BDB database files, which caused an earlier exception 
that fouled the environment. Then, a later operation got the error you 
excerpted.

So, finding the first exception will give the best clue as to what went 
wrong -- but it could have been some random/arbitrary error like 
RAM/IO-bus/disk flakiness.

You can move jobs directories around, but shouldn't do so while Heritrix 
is running; it's generally not expecting the job directories and job 
files it's already discovered to be changed outside its own operations.

There's not yet any in-UI facility for completely deleting a job. The 
safest approach at this time would be (1) quit the Heritrix JVM at a 
convenient time; (2) delete the job(s) files/directories; (3) restart 
the Heritrix JVM.

- Gordon @ IA

On 5/25/10 10:36 PM, sriram_varahan1 wrote:
>
>
> Hi Steve,
>
> I am using Heritrix 3.1.1. I am running it under Linux.
>
> Maybe the way I am using it could cause an issue. I run a job and then
> delete the job from the directory and move it to another location. Then
> when I need to perform the job again I copy it back.
>
> Is this known to cause any issue?
>
> Is there a clean way of deleting a job in Heritrix 3?
>
> I am operating it using scripts and issuing commands through curl.
>
>
> Thanks,
> Sriram
>
>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "steve@..." <steve@...> wrote:
>  >
>  > hi Sriram,
>  >
>  > hard to say what might have gone wrong from the job log.
>  > please check the heritrix_out.log for any errors as well.
>  > what version of heritrix are you running, on which platform?
>  > maybe attach your order.xml file for us to look at too.
>  >
>  > /steve@...
>  >
>  >
>  >
>  > On 5/19/10 12:16 AM, sriram_varahan1 wrote:
>  > >
>  > >
>  > > Hello,
>  > >
>  > > I have been running Heritrix for some time and recently I got this
>  > > strange exception while launching a job. The details from the job.log
>  > > are as follows:
>  > >
>  > > 2010-05-18T15:43:47.929Z SEVERE Unhandled exception or error
> intercepted
>  > > 2010-05-18T15:43:47.993Z INFO Job instance discarded
>  > > 2010-05-18T15:43:48.364Z INFO Job instantiated
>  > > 2010-05-18T15:43:48.452Z INFO Job launched
>  > > 2010-05-18T15:43:48.576Z SEVERE RuntimeException:
>  > > com.sleepycat.je.EnvironmentFailureException: (JE 4.0.71) Environment
>  > > must be closed, caused by:
> com.sleepycat.je.EnvironmentFailureException:
>  > > Environment invalid becau se of previous exception: (JE 4.0.71)
>  > > /root/test_job/state com.sleepycat.je.log.ChecksumException: Read
>  > > invalid log entry type: 99 LOG_CHECKSUM: Checksum invalid on read, log
>  > > is likely invalid. Environment is invalid and must be closed.
>  > > fetchTarget of 0x0/0x40904a parent IN=13 IN
>  > > class=com.sleepycat.je.tree.BIN lastFullVersion=0x2/0xb1fb2
>  > > parent.getDirty()=false state=0 (in thread 'test_job launchthread')
>  > > 2010-05-18T15:43:50.051Z SEVERE Unhandled exception or error
> intercepted
>  > >
>  > > Can someone please shed some light on the error and what I would
> need to
>  > > do to avoid this in the future.
>  > >
>  > > Thanks,
>  > > Sriram.
>  >
>
